author: Caso
title: C64 NFTs Minter(on-chain+identity)
description: Minting signed assets fully on-chain , allowing creators to distribute authenticated and verifiable content with long-term availability.

assessments.note: 100 percent on-chain NFTs can be an ideal way to save high-value NFTs securely and permanently. The proposal will offer the community an alternate schema of things that will be highly secure. Being a open-source initiative it will be a good value to the dev community in Cardano to innovate further.
The proposal surfaces the lifetime problems of external resources when minting NFTs. The proposed solution is, however, only feasible for very limited use.
This is a great project that would produces a repeated use case for user to interact with the cardano blockchain

This proposal addresses Cardano Fund 5: Metadata Challenge. The project proposal is solid and can impact many people seeking to get exposure to NFT through the Cardano Blockchain. The problem and solution in the proposal are well described and explained. This proposal, if implemented correctly, will transform bring a lot of new users to the Cardano Blockchain Ecosystems.

The proposal completely addresses a specific use case for the storage of "documents" (NFTs) directly in transaction metadata, even supporting cases that exceed the 16kB transaction-size limit, and avoiding off-chain dependencies like IPFS or Arweave. Additionally, the proposal provides a well-thought-out emphasis on usability, relying on a light wallet that allows flexibility in the choice of trusted endpoints. The proposal acknowledges that full on-chain storage is not desirable for all use cases. The proposal is vague about privacy considerations and the details of how authentication "from artists' websites or business cards" would occur.
The proposal has provided verifiable credentials and has excellent experience in Cardano software development. Therefore it is very likely that the proposal will be Implemented successfully.

It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because it includes a straightforward plan which will serve the Cardano Community Users to get exposure to the NFT market through Cardano Blockchain. This proposal is highly feasible as it encompasses an Emurgo team that has the skillset to build this solution. The only question is how much time per week will the team dedicate to this project.

The proposed team has demonstrated skills and engagement with software development and Cardano. The detailed proposed solutions demonstrates solid planning and thorough understanding of the issues involved and the steps required to achieve full on-chain NFTs. Under "Blocking Problems . . .", it would have been useful if the proposal had discussed cryptographic issues and approaches related to the identity aspects of the proposal.
Yes, approach and links to existing GitHub projects suggest that the team has thought about the problem deeply and is in a position to execute.
assessments.reply: He does not explain why he evaluated the project with a 4 instead of a 5.

assessments.note: The proposal provides a good level of detail on what will be produced and why it addresses the challenge
The roadmap and the stages of development are clearly defined with cost analysis. The availability of this tool can act as a catalyst for migration of high value NFT minting to cardano.
There is a timeline provided and a basic breakdown of the funds requested.

This project needs a detailed roadmap of the project deliverable. What are the milestones or steps to fully integrate this product? What are the KPI's (How many by when)? How much time will the team dedicate per week to this part-time project?
assessments.reply: As part-time work, project lead will dedicate at least 4 hours a day, assuming that a normal working day is 8 hours. The progress and milestones of the project can be followed through the Github repository. The development has already begun, although it is officially considered that it begins once the funds are received.

assessments.note: Although it would have been helpful to separately list the specific deliverables, the "Proposed Solution" section contains sufficient detail to audit progress and success.

solution: Development of a light wallet that provides sovereignty to mint and sign non-fungible tokens (NFTs) 100% on-chain from digital assets .
